Title: Applications Are Compiled with Stack Cookies Enabled
DirectLink: Applications Are Compiled with Stack Cookies Enabled

Data:
==Applies To==

* All iOS applications.

==What to Check For==

Verify that applications are compiled with stack cookies enabled.

==Why==

Stack cookies help mitigate buffer overflow vulnerabilities.

==How to Check==

To verify that stack cookies are enabled:

# **Open XCode.** Launch the XCode IDE.
# **Check compiler flags.** Examine the "Compile Sources" window to make sure the //-fstack-protector-all// flag is present in the "Compiler Flags" column for each file that is to be compiled.

==How to Fix==

To use stack cookies:
# **Open XCode.** Launch the XCode IDE.
# **Add compiler flags.** Add the //-fstack-protector-all// flag to each file that is to be compiled in the XCode "Compile Sources" window in the "Compiler Flags" column.

==Memory Management Guidelines==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000112fc5|Compile Applications with Stack Cookies Enabled]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000008d3865|Do Not Reference Freed Objects]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000798d06|Use Automatic Reference Counting]]

==Memory Management Checklists==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000841cc6|Applications Are Compiled with Stack Cookies Enabled]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000842659|Freed Objects Are Not Referenced]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000189cf8|Automatic Reference Counting Is Used]]
